logic_summary: Updated Tympanometry findings and numeric results for Left ear (Type Ad, 5.9 mmhos) as per remarks.
Updated WAI findings to describe Left ear dip at 300-800 Hz as per remarks.
Added SRT data (Right 5 dB, Left 55 dB) to Speech Audiometry numeric results.
Added new Acoustic Reflex Thresholds test with provided data.
Updated Overall Audiologic Summary to reflect conductive loss and abnormal middle ear findings (Type Ad).
Updated counseling point to replace 'damage is to the inner ear/cochlea' with 'conductive loss' and corrected the context regarding middle ear status.

patch_ops.value: Right ear: Type A tympanogram. Left ear: Type Ad tympanogram with high static admittance (5.9 mmhos).
Right ear: Normal reflectance. Left ear: Dip/notch below normal range at 300-800 Hz.

value.name: Acoustic Reflex Thresholds
value.key_findings: Right Ipsi present at 90 dB HL. Left Ipsi and Contralateral reflexes are absent (NR).

patch_ops.value: The evaluation reveals normal hearing sensitivity in the right ear and a moderate conductive hearing loss in the left ear (PTA 55 dB HL). Word recognition is excellent in the left ear when presented at suprathreshold levels (94% at 85 dB HL). Middle ear function is abnormal in the left ear, evidenced by a Type Ad tympanogram (Ytm 5.9 mmhos) and a reflectance dip at 300-800 Hz. The negative Stenger test supports the validity of the left-sided hearing loss, consistent with the reported trauma.
The tests for your middle ear system show abnormalities consistent with a conductive loss.
